channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Why Norrie exit underlines how Britain is punching below weight
item.description: Britain is one of the richest tennis nations in the world but once again its singles players have not reached the second week at a Grand Slam.

item.title: Putintseva drowns out 'disrespectful' crowd with rabbit song
item.description: Yulia Putintseva turns to a song about rabbits to drown out the "disrespectful" crowd during her Australian Open third-round match.

item.title: 'Not again' - Medvedev battles back from brink
item.description: Daniil Medvedev lives up to his billing as a five-set expert with a comeback victory over Fabian Marozsan to reach the Australian Open fourth round.

item.title: Putintseva responds to boos with dancing and kisses at Australian Open
item.description: Yulia Putintseva dances and blows kisses in response to boos from the crowd after she beats Turkish qualifier Zeynep Sonmez at the Australian Open.

item.title: 'Emotionally all over the place' - gritty Sabalenka wins
item.description: World number one Aryna Sabalenka says she was "emotionally all over the place" as she squeezes into the Australian Open fourth round.

item.title: Australian Open moves play with 40C heat expected
item.description: The Australian Open has brought forward Saturday's order of play as part of plans to cope with temperatures of 40C in Melbourne.

item.title: What are the heat rules at Australian Open?
item.description: At what point do the conditions become unplayable and put players' health at risk at the Australian Open?

item.title: Norrie loses to Zverev to end British singles hopes
item.description: Cameron Norrie loses to world number three Alexander Zverev in four sets to end British interest in singles at the Australian Open.

item.title: Osaka apologises for 'disrespecting' Cirstea
item.description: Naomi Osaka apologises for "disrespecting" Sorana Cirstea after receiving a frosty handshake from the Romanian after their Australian Open second-round match.

item.title: 'I don't want to give myself too much of a hard time'
item.description: British number one Emma Raducanu says she is leaving the Australian Open with her "head held high" after losing 7-6 (7-3) 6-2 to Austria's Anastasia Potapova in the second round.

item.title: Players at 'high risk' as tennis chases sun
item.description: With high temperatures and very high UV levels at the Australian Open, BBC Sport looks at the effects of playing for hours outdoors.

item.title: How to follow Australian Open across the BBC
item.description: Jannik Sinner and Madison Keys have begun their Australian Open title defences - follow the tournament across the BBC.

item.title: Wawrinka, 40, wins epic to join Djokovic & Cilic in third round
item.description: Stan Wawrinka wins a marathon five-set thriller against qualifier Arthur Gea, while fellow veterans Novak Djokovic and Marin Cilic advance in straight sets.

item.title: 'It sucked' - Pegula & Musetti put friendships aside to progress
item.description: Jessica Pegula says it "sucked" and Lorenzo Musetti admits it "was not easy" as both put friendships aside to crush their doubles partners at the Australian Open.

item.title: Raducanu's 'most dispiriting' Slam display - what went wrong?
item.description: After Emma Raducanu suffered a humbling Australian Open second-round exit, BBC Sport analyses where the Briton goes next.

item.title: 'Where's the after-party?' - last Briton standing Norrie laps up support
item.description: British number two Cameron Norrie pulls through a rain-delayed match to move past United States' Emilio Nava in the Australian Open second round.

item.title: Davidovich Fokina criticises 'ignorant drunks' in crowd
item.description: Alejandro Davidovich Fokina calls out "ignorant drunks" as he confronts the crowd during his win over Reilly Opelka in the Australian Open second round.

item.title: Coffee, cards & golf with Federer - how do players spend a day off?
item.description: A round of golf with Roger Federer or coffee and sleep. How do players spend their days off at the Australian Open?

item.title: How popularity overwhelmed Eala - and the Australian Open
item.description: Alexandra Eala may have only played one Australian Open singles match but she was the biggest first-round draw by far at Melbourne Park.

item.title: 'Modelled on a jellyfish' - Osaka backs up 'spectacular' outfit with win
item.description: How Naomi Osaka's jellyfish-inspired outfit stole the show in her hard-fought Australian Open first-round win over Antonia Ruzic.

item.title: Out-of-sorts Raducanu beaten in Australian Open second round
item.description: Britain's Emma Raducanu is below-par in an Australian Open second-round defeat by Austria's Anastasia Potapova.

item.title: Victorious Sinner sees 'room to improve' on serve
item.description: Jannik Sinner says he does not feel "very safe" with changes he has made to his serve, despite needing just 68 minutes to start his Australian Open title defence.

item.title: 'More to life than tennis' - father-to-be Ruud prepared to leave Melbourne early
item.description: Norway's Casper Ruud says he "probably won't be here the next day" if his wife goes into labour during the Australian Open.

item.title: 'Timid' Keys overcomes nerves to start title defence with win
item.description: Madison Keys overcomes nerves to begin her Australian Open title defence with victory over Grand Slam debutant Oleksandra Oliynykova.

item.title: Watch: Amateur beats Sinner in One Point Slam title win
item.description: Watch amateur tennis player beat men's world number two Jannik Sinner and women's world number 117 Joanna Garland to earn A$1m (Â£496,835) in Australian Open's new Million Dollar One Point Slam.

item.title: Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka in 'Battle of the Sexes'
item.description: Watch the best moments between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios at the Battle of the Sexes in Dubai.

item.title: 'Point of the match!' - Sabalenka hits 'amazing' winner against Kyrgios
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka hits an 'amazing' return against Nick Kyrgios at the Battle of the Sexes in Dubai.

item.title: 1973 Battle of the Sexes was about social change - King
item.description: American tennis legend Billie Jean King says the upcoming 'Battle of the Sexes' match between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios is "not the same" as her 1973 victory over Bobby Riggs.

item.title: Sabalenka confident 'Battle of the Sexes' won't damage women's sport
item.description: BBC Sport speaks to Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios about their controversial Battle of the Sexes-style match, set to take place in Dubai on 28 December.

item.title: More money and bigger say - are top-10 stars being reasonable?
item.description: As another Grand Slam season dawns, many players still believe they are undervalued and denied a voice in key decisions made by the majors.

item.title: The junior Slam champion who match-fixed to 'escape' tennis
item.description: Shortly after winning the 2016 Australian Open boys' title, a disillusioned Oliver Anderson was arrested for throwing a set - now he is rebuilding his career.

item.title: When Billie Jean beat Bobby - the Battle of the Sexes that defined an era
item.description: When Aryna Sabalenka faces Nick Kyrgios, it will be under the banner of the Battle of the Sexes - but the stakes will not be as high as those that faced Billie Jean King 52 years ago.

item.title: Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka - but what did 'Battle of the Sexes' achieve?
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka loses to Nick Kyrgios in a Battle of the Sexes-style match that lacked the intensity and entertainment promised in the build-up.

item.title: 'It gives me chills' - Italian 'brotherhood' inspires Davis Cup hat-trick
item.description: Flavio Cobolli and Matteo Berrettini lead Italy to a historic third straight Davis Cup title in Bologna.

item.title: Valuable lessons and tough losses - world number one Sabalenka's 2025
item.description: How some self-reflection on a mid-season holiday helped Aryna Sabalenka go from near-misses to year-end number one.

item.title: Women's tennis going in right direction - King
item.description: Billie Jean King, founder of the WTA, believes the organisation's billion-dollar deal with Mercedes shows the tour "continues to lead the way" in women's sport.

item.title: Boulter loses to Pegula as GB out of BJK Cup
item.description: Watch the best shots, as the United States' Jessica Pegula fights back from a set down to beat Katie Boulter and knock Great Britain out of the Billie Jean King Cup at the semi-final stage.

item.title: GB's Kartal runs Navarro close in BJK Cup semi-final
item.description: A battling Sonay Kartal falls to the United States' Emma Navarro, as Great Britain go 1-0 down in the semi-finals of the Billie Jean King Cup.

item.title: Boulter win puts GB into BJK Cup semi-finals
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Katie Boulter's win over Moyuka Uchijima sees Great Britain secure a 2-0 win over Japan, setting up a Billie Jean King Cup semi-final with the United States.

item.title: GB's Kartal dominates Shibahara in BJK Cup match win
item.description: Watch the best shots, as Sonay Kartal beats Ena Shibahara of Japan to give Great Britain a 1-0 lead in their Billie Jean King Cup quarter-final tie.

item.title: Borg will fight cancer 'like it's a Wimbledon final'
item.description: Tennis legend Bjorn Borg says "I hope I'm gonna be OK" after being diagnosed with "extremely aggressive" prostate cancer.

item.title: How will GB cope without Raducanu in BJK Cup?
item.description: Emma Raducanu is missing the Billie Jean King Cup to focus on the WTA Tour.

item.title: Alcaraz overcomes Sinner to win US Open
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz triumphs in the latest chapter of his compelling rivalry with Jannik Sinner, earning a four-set victory to regain the US Open title.

item.title: 'A dream come true' - Alcaraz on winning US Open & reaching world No 1
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz says it's a "dream come true" after winning his second US Open title and regaining the No. 1 spot in the world rankings.

item.title: Sabalenka retains US Open to win first Grand Slam of 2025
item.description: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka beats American Amanda Anisimova 6-3 7-6 (7-3) to retain the US Open and win her first Grand Slam of 2025, having already lost the Australian and French Open finals earlier this year.

item.title: Who has won tennis' 'Battle of the Sexes'?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team details the history of 'Battle of the Sexes' matches in tennis

item.title: What is US Open prize money?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how much prize money is on offer at the US Open.

item.title: Why is there a pineapple on Wimbledon's men's trophy?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why there is a pineapple on the top of the Wimbledon trophy for the winner of the men's singles.

item.title: Why were there no line judges at Wimbledon 2025?
item.description: Wimbledon are relying on electronic line calling to judge whether a ball is in or out.
